item.title: Parisians Are Shaken but Defiant in 11th Arrondissement
item.description: The multicultural, rapidly gentrifying district, the site of at least five attacks on Friday and the Charlie Hebdo attack in Januar, is known for its “bourgeois bonhomie.”
item.dc:creator: DAN BILEFSKY
item.media:credit: Pierre Terdjman for The New York Times
item.media:description: The 11th Arrondissement neighborhood of Paris, rapidly gentrifying but with a gritty edge, is known for its "bourgeois bonhomie."

item.title: Paris Attacks Shift Europe’s Migrant Focus to Security
item.description: Officials across Europe were calling for even stronger border controls, stricter screening of migrants and some way to reduce the flow.
item.category: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
item.dc:creator: RICK LYMAN and ALISON SMALE

item.title: 15 Sudanese Migrants Killed at Egypt-Israel Border, Officials Say
item.description: One account said the migrants had been shot by the Egyptian police for trying to cross the border, but another said they had been caught in the middle of a shootout with smugglers.
item.category: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
item.dc:creator: KAREEM FAHIM and MERNA THOMAS

item.title: Israeli Forces Arrest Palestinian in Drive-By Shooting in West Bank
item.description: The authorities said the suspect’s father had informed the military about his son’s involvement in the hope of preventing the demolition of the family home.
item.dc:creator: ISABEL KERSHNER

item.title: Paris Attacks: What We Know and Don’t Know
item.description: A briefing with the latest information.
item.dc:creator: VICTORIA SHANNON
item.media:description: A memorial outside the Carillon restaurant in Paris on Sunday, one of the sites of the attacks on Friday.

item.title: French Warplanes Strike Islamic State Militants in Syria
item.description: France launched the assault after President François Hollande held a meeting Saturday with senior security officials.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: ALISSA J. RUBIN and KATRIN BENNHOLD
item.media:description: Police officers in the Molenbeek area of Brussels on Saturday.

item.title: Obama and Putin Discuss ISIS and Syria in Informal Conversation
item.description: The two men, in Turkey for the Group of 20 summit meeting, talked for 35 minutes, though a Russian official said they disagreed on how to deal with with the Islamic State.
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL D. SHEAR

item.title: Obama Calls Paris Events ‘an Attack on the Civilized World’
item.description: Meeting with world leaders in Turkey, the president vowed to stand with the French authorities as they hunt down the terrorists.
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL D. SHEAR
item.media:description: President Obama, left, and President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey after a news conference in Antalya, Turkey, on Sunday.

item.title: Manhunt Underway as Investigation of Paris Attacks Widens
item.description: The authorities released a photo of an eighth suspect in the attacks and confirmed that at least three of the other attackers were French citizens.
item.dc:creator: AURELIEN BREEDEN, ADAM NOSSITER and KIMIKO DE FREYTAS-TAMURA

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: Indian, Liberal and Anxious
item.description: Why can't Indian liberals celebrate the BJP's loss in the Bihar election?
item.dc:creator: MUKUL KESAVAN

item.title: Paris Attackers Communicated With ISIS, Officials Say
item.description: The information adds evidence to the assertions that the radical group coordinated or helped carry out the attacks rather than simply inspiring them.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: KATRIN BENNHOLD and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT
item.media:description: Police officers in the Molenbeek area of Brussels on Saturday.

item.title: Beirut, Also the Site of Deadly Attacks, Feels Forgotten
item.description: A global outpouring of grief followed the Paris assaults, but no such solidarity was expressed a day earlier when 43 civilians were killed in Lebanon.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
item.dc:creator: ANNE BARNARD
item.media:description: The site of Thursday's twin suicide bombings in the Burj al-Barajneh neighborhood of Beirut, Lebanon.

item.title: Attackers in Paris ‘Did Not Give Anybody a Chance’
item.description: Parisians who went out on Friday night to listen to music, watch soccer, or enjoy a meal or drink with friends, quickly became engulfed in a blood-soaked drama.
item.dc:creator: ANDREW HIGGINS and MILAN SCHREUER
item.media:description: People lay on the sidewalk outside a cafe on Friday night while others tended to them, after a series of coordinated attacks in and around Paris that left more than 120 people dead.

item.title: Strategy Shift for ISIS: Inflicting Terror in Distant Lands
item.description: The recent violence in Paris and Beirut and the downing of a Russian passenger jet appear to be part of a centrally planned campaign of attacks by an evolving Islamic State.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: ERIC SCHMITT and DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK
item.media:description: The Paris attacks appeared part of a larger campaign by the Islamic State.

item.title: Kurds Investigate Reports of Mass Grave of Yazidis in Sinjar
item.description: A Kurdistan government team plans to excavate the site to try to confirm suspicions of executed older Yazidi women whom the Islamic State did not want as sex slaves.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL R. GORDON

item.title: Kurds in Iraq Face Fast and Erratic Threat in ISIS Suicide Drivers
item.description: Cellphone video recorded by a Kurdish fighter captures a frightening truck bomb explosion near Sinjar, one day before Kurds captured the city.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL R. GORDON
item.media:credit: Bryan Denton for The New York Times
item.media:description: Kurdish fighters ordered a truck to stop Friday in Sinjar, Iraq. The Islamic State is using suicide drivers to attack their positions on a strategic highway.

item.title: Al Aqsa TV Chronicles Palestinian Uprising, Keeping Hamas in Picture
item.description: The Hamas-run channel, broadcasting from Gaza City, covers the distant conflict as a way for Hamas to remain relevant and challenge its rival, Fatah.
item.dc:creator: DIAA HADID and MAJD AL WAHEIDI
item.media:credit: Loulou d’Aki for The New York Times
item.media:description: Raji al-Hams, right, is the host of “This Is Palestine,” a political program on the Hamas-run Al Aqsa satellite channel in Gaza City.

item.title: 5 Ukrainian Soldiers Killed as Cease-Fire Offenses Rise
item.description: The Ukrainian military said the death toll was its highest since a fragile cease-fire with pro-Russian separatists began two months ago.
item.dc:creator: REUTERS

item.title: Paris Gunmen Single Out François Hollande, and Leave Him With Few Palatable Responses
item.description: The French president, who was reportedly mentioned by name as attackers stormed a rock concert in Paris, faces a difficult and perilous path forward as he decides how to respond.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: ALISSA J. RUBIN
item.media:description: President François Hollande of France in Paris on Saturday. Attackers at a rock concert reportedly mentioned him by name.

item.title: Day After Paris Attacks, Familiar Fear Grips a Wary New York
item.description: The catastrophic events in Paris on Friday put law enforcement agencies on heightened alert, and left people waking up to the weekend in the city coping with a creeping sense of dread.
item.dc:creator: BENJAMIN MUELLER and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT
item.media:credit: Hilary Swift for The New York Times
item.media:description: Police officers at the National September 11 Memorial in New York on Saturday.
